summary: The documents suggest that 'Washington (EUR/BNL)' was a recipient of intelligence reports related to the Vlaamse Militanten Orde (VMO), a Flemish militant order. The documents indicate that Washington was seeking information about the VMO, possibly in connection to the House Committee on Assassinations investigation into the JFK assassination. However, NITRUST, a liaison contact, was reluctant to share information due to Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) concerns and potential leaks. NIGALE also declined to prepare a report on the VMO for the House of Representatives Committee, citing a lack of information on VMO-American citizen contacts between 1968 and 1970. The documents highlight a reluctance to share information about the VMO with the House Committee, possibly indicating a sensitivity surrounding the topic.
significance: Washington (EUR/BNL)'s significance in the JFK context lies in its apparent role as a recipient of intelligence related to the Vlaamse Militanten Orde (VMO) and its connection to the House Committee on Assassinations investigation. The reluctance of other entities to share information with Washington suggests that the VMO may have been a sensitive topic in the context of the JFK assassination investigation.
